page.title: 20Nature Study.
page.content: On the banks of the River Lossie a wasp bike was hidden beneath a small part of the bank where the river had eaten it away. We walked along the bank and found a birds nest in the bank which we couldn't identify but the egg shells were beneath the nest. The eggs were small, white with red dots. There was a small weir on the river. At Cloddach Quarry we saw a large tree which had been dug up. It was a black oak. It was very heavy. The black oak was supposed to be 10000 years old. We also found Giant Hogweed growing on the banks of the River Lossie. This plant is very dangerous_ if you touch it, your skin can be badly blistered. Moray District Council are trying to irradicate the plant but they have to spray at exactly the right time and this is proving very difficult to get right.
